items.name: MISR
items.description: TAMP non-secure masked interrupt status register.

items.name: SMISR
items.description: TAMP secure masked interrupt status register.

fields.name: TAMPAM
fields.description: Tamper x active mode. (x=1-8)

fields.name: ATOSEL
fields.description: Active tamper shared output x selection The selected output must be available in the package pinout. (x=1-4)

fields.name: ATCKSEL
fields.description: Active tamper RTC asynchronous prescaler clock selection These bits selects the RTC asynchronous prescaler stage output.The selected clock is CK_ATPRE. fCK_ATPRE = fRTCCLK / 2ATCKSEL when (PREDIV_A+1) = 128. ... These bits can be written only when all active tampers are disabled. The write protection remains for up to 1.5 ck_atpre cycles after all the active tampers are disable.

fields.name: ATPER
fields.description: Active tamper output change period The tamper output is changed every CK_ATPER = (2ATPER x CK_ATPRE) cycles. Refer to.

fields.name: ATOSHARE
fields.description: Active tamper output sharing TAMP_IN1 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL1 TAMP_IN2 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL2 TAMP_IN3 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL3 TAMP_IN4 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL4 TAMP_IN5 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL5 TAMP_IN6 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL6 TAMP_IN7 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL7 TAMP_IN8 is compared with TAMPOUTSEL8.

fields.name: FLTEN
fields.description: Active tamper filter enable.

fields.name: ATOSEL
fields.description: Active tamper shared output x selection The selected output must be available in the package pinout. Bits 9:8 are the mirror of ATOSELx[1:0] in the TAMP_ATCR1, and so can also be read or written through TAMP_ATCR1. (x=1-8)

fields.name: PRNG
fields.description: Pseudo-random generator value This field provides the values of the PRNG output. Because of potential inconsistencies due to synchronization delays, PRNG must be read at least twice. The read value is correct if it is equal to previous read value. This field can only be read when the APB is in secure mode.

fields.name: SEEDF
fields.description: Seed running flag This flag is set by hardware when a new seed is written in the TAMP_ATSEEDR. It is cleared by hardware when the PRNG has absorbed this new seed, and by system reset. The TAMP APB cock must not be switched off as long as SEEDF is set.

fields.name: INITS
fields.description: Active tamper initialization status This flag is set by hardware when the PRNG has absorbed the first 128-bit seed, meaning that the enabled active tampers are functional. This flag is cleared when the active tampers are disabled.

fields.name: TAMPE
fields.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_INx enable. (x=1-8)

fields.name: ITAMP1E
fields.description: Internal tamper 1 enable.

fields.name: ITAMP2E
fields.description: Internal tamper 2 enable.

fields.name: ITAMP3E
fields.description: Internal tamper 3 enable.

fields.name: ITAMP15E

fields.name: TAMPPOM
fields.description: Tamper x potential mode. (x=1-8)

fields.name: TAMPMSK
fields.description: Tamper x mask. The tamper x interrupt must not be enabled when TAMPxMSK is set. (x=1-3)

fields.name: BKBLOCK
fields.description: Backup registers and device secrets access blocked.

fields.name: BKERASE
fields.description: Backup registers and device secrets erase Writing ‘1’ to this bit reset the backup registers and device secrets(1). Writing 0 has no effect. This bit is always read as 0.

fields.name: TAMPTRG
fields.description: Active level for tamper x input If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper x input rising edge triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper x input falling edge triggers a tamper detection event. (x=1-8)

fields.name: ITAMP1POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 1 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP2POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 2 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP3POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 3 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP4POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 4 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP5POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 5 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP6POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 6 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP7POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 7 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP8POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 8 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP9POM
fields.description: Internal tamper 9 potential mode.

fields.name: ITAMP11POM

fields.name: ITAMP15POM

fields.name: TAMPFREQ
fields.description: Tamper sampling frequency Determines the frequency at which each of the TAMP_INx inputs are sampled.

fields.name: TAMPFLT
fields.description: TAMP_INx filter count These bits determines the number of consecutive samples at the specified level (TAMP*TRG) needed to activate a tamper event. TAMPFLT is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

fields.name: TAMPPRCH
fields.description: TAMP_INx precharge duration These bit determines the duration of time during which the pull-up/is activated before each sample. TAMPPRCH is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

fields.name: TAMPPUDIS
fields.description: TAMP_INx pull-up disable This bit determines if each of the TAMPx pins are precharged before each sample.

fields.name: TAMPIE
fields.description: Tamper x interrupt enable. (x=1-8)

fields.name: ITAMP1IE
fields.description: Internal tamper 1 interrupt enable.

fields.name: CNT1PRIV
fields.description: Monotonic counter 1 privilege protection.

fields.name: BKPRWPRIV
fields.description: Backup registers zone 1 privilege protection.

fields.name: BKPWPRIV
fields.description: Backup registers zone 2 privilege protection.

fields.name: TAMPPRIV
fields.description: Tamper privilege protection (excluding backup registers) Note: Refer to for details on the read protection.

fields.name: RPCFG0
fields.description: Configurable resource 0 protection.

fields.name: CTAMPF
fields.description: Clear TAMPx detection flag. Writing 1 in this bit clears the TAMPxF bit in the TAMP_SR register. (x=1-8)

fields.name: CITAMP1F
fields.description: Clear ITAMP1 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP1F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

fields.name: CITAMP2F
fields.description: Clear ITAMP2 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP2F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

fields.name: CITAMP3F
fields.description: Clear ITAMP3 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP3F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

fields.name: CITAMP4F

fields.name: CITAMP7F
fields.description: Clear ITAMP7 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP7F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

fields.name: CITAMP8F
fields.description: Clear ITAMP8 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP8F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

fields.name: CITAMP9F

fields.name: CITAMP11F

fields.name: CITAMP12F

fields.name: CITAMP15F

fields.name: BKPRWSEC
fields.description: Backup registers read/write protection offset Protection zone 1 is defined for backup registers from TAMP_BKP0R to TAMP_BKPxR (x = BKPRWSEC-1, from 0 to 128). if TZEN=1, these backup registers can be read and written only with secure access. If TZEN=0: the protection zone 1 can be read and written with non-secure access. If BKPRWSEC = 0: there is no protection zone 1. If BKPRWPRIV is set, BKPRWSEC[7:0] can be written only in privileged mode.

fields.name: CNT1SEC
fields.description: Monotonic counter 1 secure protection.

fields.name: BKPWSEC
fields.description: Backup registers write protection offset Protection zone 2 is defined for backup registers from TAMP_BKPyR (y = BKPRWSEC, from 0 to 128) to TAMP_BKPzR (z = BKPWSEC-1, from 0 to 128, BKPWSEC ≥ BKPRWSEC): if TZEN=1, these backup registers can be written only with secure access. They can be read with secure or non-secure access. Protection zone 3 defined for backup registers from TAMP_BKPtR (t = BKPWSEC, from 0 to 127). They can be read or written with secure or non-secure access. If TZEN=0: the protection zone 2 can be read and written with non-secure access. If BKPWSEC = 0 or if BKPWSEC ≤ BKPRWSEC: there is no protection zone 2. If BKPWPRIV is set, BKPRWSEC[7:0] can be written only in privileged mode.

fields.name: BHKLOCK
fields.description: Boot hardware key lock This bit can be read and can only be written to 1 by software. It is cleared by hardware together with the backup registers following a tamper detection event or when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

fields.name: TAMPSEC
fields.description: Tamper protection (excluding monotonic counters and backup registers) Note: Refer to for details on the read protection.

fieldset/SMISR.description: TAMP secure masked interrupt status register.

fields.name: TAMPF
fields.description: TAMPx detection flag. This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMPx input. (x=1-8)
